clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Adalimumab on Patient-reported Outcomes in Ulcerative Colitis
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of the Impact of Adalimumab on Patient-reported Outcomes (PROs) in Canadian Patients Suffering From Moderate-to-severe Ulcerative Colitis (UCanADA)

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the real-life effect after 1 year of adalimumab treatment on psychological distress/depression symptoms in moderate-to-severe Ulcerative Colitis (UC) patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in depressive symptoms at Week 52
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 52 or at the time of stopping adalimumab, or at the time of Premature Discontinuation
primary_outcome.description: It is measured by the Patient Health Questionnaire - 9 Items (PHQ-9).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in depressive symptoms at Week 8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 8, or at the time of stopping adalimumab, or at the time of Premature Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: It is measured by the Patient Health Questionnaire - 9 Items (PHQ-9).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the proportion of patients with PHQ-9 >= 10
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 52 or at the time of stopping adalimumab, or at the time of Premature Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: The change from baseline in the proportion of patients with PHQ-9 >= 10 is assessed at week 8 and 52.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 52 or at the time of stopping adalimumab, or at the time of Premature Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: It is measured by the Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) Disability Index at weeks 8 and 52.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Overall quality of life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 52, or at the time of stopping adalimumab, or at the time of Premature Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: It is measured by the EuroQol 5-Dimensions, 5 Levels (EQ-5D-5L) and EQ5D VAS at weeks 8 and 52.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Ulcerative Colitis (UC)-specific quality of life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 52 or at the time of stopping adalimumab, or at the time of Premature Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: It is measured by the Short Quality of Life in Inflammatory Bowel Disease Questionnaire (SIBDQ) at weeks 8 and 52.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 52, or at the time of stopping adalimumab, or at the time of Premature Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: It is measured by the Functional Assessment Chronic Illness Therapy-Fatigue (FACIT-F) at weeks 8 and 52.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Sleep impairment,
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 52, or at the time of stopping adalimumab, or at the time of Premature Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: It is measured by the Medical Outcomes Study Sleep scale (MOS Sleep) at weeks 8 and 52.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Work productivity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 52, or at the time of stopping adalimumab, or at the time of Premature Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: The change from baseline in work productivity is assessed at week 8 and 52.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessing Simple Clinical Colitis Activity Index (SCCAI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Week 52, or at the time of stopping adalimumab, or at the time of Premature Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: SCCAI is used to access response and remission rates.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Fecal Calprotectin levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 52, or at the time of stopping adalimumab, or at the time of Premature Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: The change from baseline in Fecal Calprotectin levels will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Week 52, or at the time of stopping adalimumab, or at the time of Premature Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: Mayo endoscopic sub-score will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with Complications including hospitalization and surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Week 52, or at the time of stopping adalimumab, or at the time of Premature Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients with complications including hospitalization and surgery will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Week 52, or at the time of stopping adalimumab, or at the time of Premature Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients on steroids will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Physician's Global Assessment (PGA)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 0 to Week 52 or at the time of stopping adalimumab, or at the time of Premature Discontinuation
secondary_outcome.description: The change from baseline in Physician's Global Assessment (PGA) will be assessed.

arm_group.description: Patients will be followed for 52 weeks post initiation of adalimumab (Week 0).

study_pop.textblock: Adult males and females with moderate to severe UC patients from Canada who meet the inclusion criteria and who do not meet any of the exclusion criteria will be eligible for enrollment into the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient must voluntarily sign and date a patient authorization.
- Patient must be ≥ 18 years of age.
- Patient must have confirmed diagnosis of UC.
- Patient must have:
1. a Mayo endoscopic sub score of 2 or 3 from endoscopic investigation in the previous 3-months that is closest to the baseline visit or
2. a Mayo rectal bleeding subscore ≥ 2 and a calprotectin value greater than 250 µg/gr.
- Patient must have been prescribed adalimumab as part of his treatment by his treating physician.
- If the patient was previously treated with vedolizumab or any anti-TNF agent (except adalimumab), an appropriate washout has taken place as per routine practice.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient has previously received adalimumab.
- Patient has previously used infliximab or any anti-TNF agent and have not clinically responded at any time ("primary non-responder") unless they experienced a treatment limiting reaction.
- Patient with a history of subtotal colectomy with ileorectostomy or colectomy with ileoanal pouch, Kock pouch, or ileostomy for UC or planned bowel surgery.
- Patient with a current diagnosis of indeterminate colitis, ulcerative proctitis only, or with a current diagnosis and/or have a history of Crohn's disease.
- Patient with other tumor necrosis factor (TNF) immune-modulated disease.
- Patient has a significant history of renal, neurologic, psychiatric, endocrinologic, metabolic, immunologic, cardiovascular, or hepatic disease that in the opinion of the investigator would adversely affect his/her participating in this study.
- A female patient is pregnant or breast-feeding.
- Patient is currently participating in another prospective study including controlled clinical trials and observational studies
